intro: Lessingianthus cephalotes, commonly known as the "Cephalotes sunflower," is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, creating a striking visual appearance. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The botanical structure of Lessingianthus cephalotes supports its role in pollination by attracting various insects, including bees and butterflies.
